Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Amulet (the god Bes)
Description: Amulet with two differently treated surfaces: the first one is flat whereas the other is fashioned in the likeness of the god Bes in frontal view, crouched, with the hands on the knees and a rounded belly. Two erect snakes frame his bearded face on either side. The head is surmounted by a plumed-headdress, which itself supports a partly damaged suspension ring in the shape of a double disc-shaped bead.
